result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar McNeal Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamar McNeal Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Lamar McNeal Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for plea hearing.  Defense will not be proceeding with a plea at this time and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Court sets the deadline of 1/23/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms. Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar McNeal Jr not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Lamar McNeal Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received an offer from the State and requests date for plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Lamar McNeal not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received discovery from the State, but awaits an offer.  Defense requests additional time to obtain and review offer with client. 

Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer P. Ferguson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar McNeal not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in trial this week.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046958,
Payable Number: 1006740,
Receipt Number: 22RP019643,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamar McNeal appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
